data.title: Incredible pizza...the taste brings me back to Sicily
data.text:
Fabulous pizza with an outstanding menu! The array of pizza selections could have you eat out every night which I attempted while on vacation:) The salads are excellent,  fresh and massive in quantity. Enjoy and just chill out with the locals as the ambience is great too.

Deborah 
Woodbridge,ON

data.title: Delicious filling pizza
data.text:
One slice is more than enough for lunch an if you get a saad or some wings you have one of the tastiest cheap eats in south beach.

Loved the spicy pepperoni and the paramasan garlic wings.

Well run friendly pizza joint.

data.title: These Guys know how to make a pizza...
data.text:
Wow, what a great menu and fantastic quality.

If you want a simple slice of pizza or something a little (or a lot) larger, this place is certainly worth a visit. Food was freshly prepared and really tasty, right mix for grabbing a quick bite at lunch or a cheap meal for the family.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Huge slices and decently priced.  Pizza was delicious!!  Thin crust is usually not my favorite but this place nailed it.  Service was also great!

data.title: HUUUUUGE!
data.text: Ordered extra large pizzas for an event & they're not kidding! They were massive! And delicious! Like any normal pizza with toppings but like 3 times the normal size. Amazing

data.title: PIZZA BAR
data.text: Great pizza salad and beer.   The service is good too.   One slice of pizza is very filling.   We went twice euring our stay

data.title: Miami Beach needs more like this
data.text: Sadly South Beach Miami is missing a trick by not encouraging more places like this. Sensible prices for excellent food. Food that you actually want to take photos off and show to your friends. Food that is made fresh to order and is hot and delicious. And the environment is pretty cool too. Rock music and beer on tap. Definitely do yourself a favour and give his place a shot.

data.title: A SLICE is the Meal
data.text: Great Pizza. One Slice here is a Meal. Slices are shareable if only need a snack. Ate here 3 times during trip.

data.title: Massive, delicious pizza (and beer)
data.text: We ate here twice when staying at Loews. They have a wide choice of pizzas available in slices and various sizes up to what looked like one big enough to sleep on :) you can eat in or take out, they also serve draft and bottled beers. Very casual atmosphere, friendly staff and the pizza is well priced and tasted very good. 5 mins walk from the beach and the Loews hotel.

data.title: Big Slice
data.text: Slices are big. you can grab a slice, drink a beer and watch a game inside this pizza bar. not much to say about service your order, eat and leave. good food.

data.title: Yummy pizza
data.text: So you get a big slice (I've seen bigger in NY) for around 5.00 and it's good although I like a lot of cheese. This has just enough and it's good. I am greedy so I had two slices (the white pizza and a tomato and basil) the white was sooooo good if you like garlic and not globs full of ricotta like a NY white slice. The tomato was good, fresh and delicious. It's good just not NY good.

user_location.name: New York, New York, United States

data.title: Cheap, Good Eats on Collins
data.text: After walking up and down Collins and Ocean to find hamburgers for $20, I was glad to find a reasonable spot to get some cheap eats.  What I didn't expect was that the pizza would be delicious and so big!  I had a HUGE slice (like 3 typical slices) and a soda for $10.  It was a great ratio of crust to toppings and the crust was New York style.  Crispy and yummy!  I would recommend this place if visiting.  If I lived in SoBe, I would go often.

data.title: A good deal
data.text: Nothing fancy about this place. A generous size slice of pizza (>10 to choose from by the slice) and a draft beer for 13 bucks. Football on the TV. Right off the beach.

data.title: Great late night spot
data.text: Great for grabbing a slice after a few too many drinks late at night!  Long line, but worth the wait if you are hungry!

data.title: Biggest slice of pizza ever!
data.text: Being used to NYC-size of pizza slices, I had to laugh when I got my 2 slices of pizza.  Enough to feed a family of 12, these slices are awesome!  Ready-made and always available, it makes it so easy to eat on the run or sit down and enjoy them "on Island time"!

data.title: quick dinner
data.text: second time going to pizza bar. the pizza is really good here. a medium pie is around 14-16 bucks. beer is alittle expensive i think

data.title: The Best!
data.text: By far the best Pizza I've had, there was a Lil bit of a wait but was so worth it. Second time around we just ordered prior to getting there. Worth the price & definitely would recommend it to others. We found parking around the corner for $1.00 on weekend it might be a Little bit harder. They also do deliver.

data.title: Good Place
data.text: We stopped here for a slice of pizza. They do have a long wait, but the pizza was pretty good. Not really worth the 45 minute wait, but it was pretty good. I would recommend going here at a time that it isn't very crowded. Otherwise, it's a great place.

data.title: Pizza bar
data.text:
Best pizza I've ever had. Kindest personal and great beer on tap. All types of pizza great music and great atmosphere at first I thought the slice was expensive until I saw the slice was the size of a pie.

Ask for Hensly he's the best pizza maker in Miami.

data.title: Four men and a pizza ...... Best in SoBe
data.text:
Actually, they're probably the best in Miami. Innocuous and easy to miss, nestled between La Provence and a slightly risqué swimwear shop.

Found this place by accident 5 years ago and now go every time we're in Miami. 
It's quite a sight seeing 4 strapping lads carrying a 32inch take out pizza: a bit ghoulish but it's like watching pall bearers😄.

The fact is however, their pizzas are superb: full stop, no ifs & no buts.

There's a huge variety to choose from and can either eat in or there's a couple of tables on the pavement for people watching.

Can buy single slice (from $6) and that's from the large so it's almost a small pizza by itself. No normal human can eat the XL but it's fun watching.

If you're in SoBe and want best pizza without paying Lincoln Road or Ocean Drive prices then I'd really recommend this place. As ever, if it's where the locals go then it's good for me. You won't be disappointed .
